frame.name: Distinctiveness
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Feature</fen> of an <fen>Entity</fen> serves to distinguish the <fen>Entity</fen> from other members of its type which have a different value for the <fen>Feature</fen>. Note that the <fen>Entity</fen> is often implicit.
<ex>His <t>distinctive</t> flowing <fex name="Feature">gait</fex> and skill with the rapier set him apart from his fellows.</ex> <ex><fex name="Feature">The swinging axe-kick</fex> was <t>characteristic</t> <fex name="Entity">of Xena</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Feature
FE.definition:
<def-root>The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which makes it different from the other members of its class.
<ex>That never depleting ammo in his arsenal - his <t>signature</t> <fex name="fea">smile</fex> - is contagious.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The item which differs from other members of its class in the <fen>Feature</fen>'s value.
<ex>These signatures may be <t>distinctive</t> <fex name="ent">of the entire Chlamydiales order</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the values of the Feature of the Entity and the Comparison_set are similar to each other.
<ex>The twins have a <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>distinct</t> walk.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>
